function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Not all studies have used a complete number of possible covariates in the analysis, potentially leading to limited findings.","Impact":"Limited findings may affect the understanding of the effectiveness of NPHIs in controlling the spread of COVID-19.","Mitigation":"Encourage the inclusion of a comprehensive set of covariates in future studies to improve the robustness of the analysis.","Technologies":"Data analysis software for handling and analyzing large datasets.","People":"Researchers, public health officials, policymakers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Confounding effect of COVID-19 diagnosis testing considerations on outcomes.","Impact":"Questioning the observed epidemiological patterns across studies.","Mitigation":"Conduct sensitivity analyses to assess the impact of changes in testing capacity on study outcomes.","Technologies":"Statistical modeling, data simulation","People":"Epidemiologists, statisticians, public health researchers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Uncertainty of a country's actual total number of infected individuals due to dependence on testing strategies and number of tests performed.","Impact":"Inaccurate estimation of the true burden of COVID-19 within a country.","Mitigation":"Improve transparency and reporting of testing strategies and results to increase accuracy of estimated infection rates.","Technologies":"Data tracking and reporting systems, surveillance tools","People":"Public health authorities, government officials, epidemiologists","Owner":"National health agencies, government"},{"Description":"Dismissal of contextual factors and merging of intervention results from different countries in the meta-analysis.","Impact":"Potential misrepresentation of the true effectiveness of NPHIs in specific contexts.","Mitigation":"Conduct separate analyses for different contextual factors and consider country-specific influences on intervention outcomes.","Technologies":"Data analysis software, statistical modeling","People":"Epidemiologists, public health researchers, statisticians","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"}]}
